New Records: Sanju Samson's 40-ball hundred is the second quickest hundred by an Indian, only bettered by Rohit Sharma's 35-ball ton against Sri Lanka in 2017.
Key Match Events: Sanju Samson's 40-ball hundred and quickfire knocks from Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik Pandya powered India to a 133-run win
Samson departed with 111 runs off 47 balls, hitting 8 fours and 8 sixes
Hardik Pandya scored a ton but was dismissed for 99 runs
Suryakumar Yadav scored 75 runs off 35 balls with 8 fours and 5 sixes
India scored 297/6 in 20 overs, the highest T20I score by a Full-Member side
Pre-Game Insights: Sanju Samson may have the team management's backing for his aggressive intent but life could be pretty tough for him without a high-impact knock
Bangladesh's most capped T20I player, Mahmudullah, will be retiring from the format after this match
Bangladesh's six-hitting record has been attributed to genetics by their assistant coach
Post-Match Reflections: Sanju Samson took a huge monkey off his back with his knock and got a standing ovation from the crowd
The match ended with India beating Bangladesh by 133 runs, clinching the series 3-0
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tanzim Hasan gave India the first wicket of the innings
Mayank Yadav took the wicket of Parvez Emon in the first over
Bangladesh struggled with the bat, failing to tonk maximums at the same rate as India in the series
